intro: Dendrobium cromwellense, commonly known as the Cromwell orchid, is an epiphytic orchid native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, cane-like pseudobulbs. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and green, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining potting media. Due to its rarity and conservation status, it is often cultivated in specialized horticultural settings.
